Reviews.Title: “3 star for sure”
Reviews.Author: Edwardfreedman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good position,the reception staff are very helpful, the room is a good size, the hotel, is perfect if you are going out a lot, good for sleeping and breakfast, not for hanging around. What I like was it was for sure 3 stars, and didnt pretend to be anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a slick modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: pablito
Reviews.Content: Since it's on a busy corner it can be very noisy with road noise but across the street Fridays through Sunday's the disco closes at 5:30 am and the people leave drunk and very loud saying goodnight but not wanting to go home. The front desk suggested throwing water but we didn't. The hotel is in a perfect location for shopping , eating, sightseeing and enjoying Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “a bechmark for travelers”
Reviews.Author: juanjo s
Reviews.Content: wow!, love actual hotel, nice premises, big rooms, excellence in service, staff always able to help with a big smile, and located in "the yolk of the egg" of barcelone. actual is the value for money benchmark

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Lekky-rkl
Reviews.Content: Good location hotel with only few steps from the underground train station (diagonal). The hotel design itself is good, reasonable price, but the mattress quality is so so. You can conveniently travel to many attractions in Barcelona with the underground trains. The staffs are very helpful. I's definitely enjoy my stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Alex Verdu - Stamford”
Reviews.Author: AlexVerdu
Reviews.Content: Amazing location and very comfortable rooms with a lovely decoration. Very friendly and helpful staff. Anything that we asked was provided within minutes. Breakfast is an excellent choice of nice Mediterranean food. Definitively good value for money. I still cannot believe that it is rated as a 3 stars hotel! I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Actual Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Katherine W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite which was a lovely room,well decorated and very clean, but not a suite in the normal sense of the word(i.e. more than one room). It was on the first floor and there was some traffic noise - not a problem if you are used to city life but probably annoying if you are used to peace and quiet. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful when asked but didn't volunteer anything. We did not have breakfast but enjoyed a free cup of tea one afternoon. Lovely for me and my 12 year old - conveniently located near the metro - but probably less good for much younger children.

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: MrCaliAdvisor
Reviews.Content: This was a great option for the best city in Europe, Great location, helpfull staff, clean rooms. Rooms are modern and clean, not overstated. If you want to a place near the best shopping and restaurants, Actual is the place, if you are looking for luxury and ammenities. this is not the place. Look into upgrading to a suite for a little bit more. Still is my place to stay in BCN hands down

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: SeattleClaudette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located, stylish and comfortable. Rooms are small, but well-equipped, comfortable and clean. Decent breakfast available on-site, or a selection of bakeries just steps away. All this at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel near La Pedrera”
Reviews.Author: Wienprater
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located on Passeig de Gracia where there are many shops & restaurants. It is located just around the corner after La Pedrera on Rossello street. We had made a reservation through Booking.com and were given a room on the 6th floor with an amazing view of Gaudi's La Pedrera (or Casa Mila) from our room window. Our room was spacious and had a modern feel to it & the bathroom was large. If you push the room window correctly, you will be able to make quite a significant opening to let the cool fresh air in. Free wifi is available in the hotel & there is a PC at the lobby for free access to internet. The metro station 'Diagonal' is a few steps away from the hotel. Casa Batllo is about 5 min walk. While La Rambla about 15min walk. The hop on & off bus stop is on the left of the hotel (in front of La Pedrera). Very convenient. There is a small cafe on the right of the hotel just a few doors away (beside the Hotel Next To). It serves a good breakfast for 3 Euros per person (bocadillo/sandwich + 1 drink/tea/coffee/juice). . Tip:If you intend to take the Hop On & Off Bus Turistic, or plan to visit Sagrada church or Casa Batllo or La Pedrera, ask the hotel reception for the voucher booklet. It costs Euro4 per person. Contains discount vouchers for various tourist attractions.The hop on & off bus costs Euro23. It costs Euro17 after you show the coupon (discount of E6 per person), Nede to show one coupon per person. 10% off Casa Batllo & La Pedrera coupon inside. Euro 1 discount for Sagrada Familia. We took the airport bus from Barcelona El Prat airport. Costs Euro 6.50 per person one way, about 30 minutes. Alight at the last stop @ Placa Catalunya. The bus stop was under construction at the time so they alighted us along Passeig de Gracia, even nearer to Hotel Actual. Walk towards the direction of La Pedrera or Casa Batllo. Once you pass La Pedrera, walk ahead till the end of the block and turn right to Rossello street. The hotel is just a few steps from the main street of Passeig de Gracia. . We will most definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Ysabel
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location, near the main road with high end shops and restaurants. I love its modern interior design. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Too bad we were only able to get a booking for one night so we had to move to another hotel for our second night in Barcelona. We would've stayed for another night in this hotel if there was an available room. Our room had a view of Passeig de Gracia. Only thing I didn't like about the hotel was that the room was small, you wouldn't have any room to walk on if you put your luggage on the floor and opened it. Buffet breakfast was filling and satisfying. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely book a room if I come back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “boutique gem with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: holidaylover25
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights at the hotel. great service throughout with staff speaking english. the hotel was ultra modern and more than comfortable wih power shower! the location was right at the heart of designer shops and luxury bars and restauranta. a 10 min walk to sagrada familia and 10 min walk in other direction to las ramblas and the heart of barcelona. walking down passieg de gracia the streets are lined with famous brands and plenty of coffee shops. zara is cheaper than in the uk so make sure you have plenty of room in your suitcase. flag down a taxi if going further afield and write down address if poor or no spanish like me! only had breakfast once at hotel - it was fine and continental but plenty of local cafes do good deals on spanish style breakfast. thankyou for a great stay! and free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “A bit warm!”
Reviews.Author: SlaveG
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in November. Having looked at many, many hotels in the city before booking this one, it was certainly good value for money, the location perfect and the rooms were spacious and clean. We opted not to have the hotel breakfast which was over 13 Euros each per day, preferring to drop into a local cafe or grab something from a stall as we walked around, so I can't comment on the food. We didn't have a great view from the room which was at the front of the hotel overlooking Rosselo, but then we weren't planning to spend much time in there anyway, so it wasn't really a consideration when booking. The safe in the room was great for stashing away passports etc. and meant we could leave the bulk of our cash behind each day. The minibar was reasonably priced compared to many hotels I've stayed in, charging 1.90 Euros for a bottle of water or soft drink, which was welcome on the first night before we'd been out to buy anything (although the tap water was supposedly safe to drink, I didn't want to risk it - I've been caught out before). There were a few minor niggles. Firstly, there's no means of making yourself a tea or coffee in the room - there may have been a machine in reception to buy a drink but I didn't actually notice. It would have been nice to have the option first thing in the morning, so make sure you stock up on supplies if you want something other than water straight from the tap when in your room. There was no bar at the hotel, so we couldn't nip down there to get anything. Secondly, the weather was still in the low 20's whilst we were there. Although all the locals seemed to be wearing thick coats, we didn't progress from short sleeved t-shirts even during the evening, so it was a bit of a shocker to have the heating on in the room when we arrived. All attempts to get the air-con working to cool us down were futile, so I went to reception to report it not working only to be told it was switched off - hot air only. Yea, ok, it was November but even with the heating off, it was stifling in our room and my keyring thermometer was hovvering around the 30 mark the whole time. That brings me on to the final niggles. The window to the room was prevented from opening more than a couple of inches as it was behind the desk. Short of moving a whole set of furniture including the TV, we had to settle for the small gap to cool down the room. That said, it was hellishly noisy on the street below until well into the early hours and even though were were on the 5th floor, it was impossible to leave it open if we wanted to get any sleep (which meant we roasted in our bed when it was closed) so a bit of a sleepless break for me who likes it cool and quiet. Those negatives aside (and to be honest, they weren't things to get too wound up about, just to be aware of if you want to book a room here), this was a great hotel in a great location for a reasonable cost. If you do book, the transfer to the city from the airport is dead easy. The Aerobus was just over 9 Euros return per person and drops you at Placa Catalunya, a 10 minute stroll, pretty much in a straight line. Overall, a great place to stay and I'd definitely book again if I were to return.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel near Passeig Gracia”
Reviews.Author: Rik D
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days in room 111 at Hotel Actuel Barcelona, following a city trip. Nice modern decor of the room. When you looked through the window, you only had a view of a wall, but this could not spoil the fun, because we were only in the room to sleep. The room has a safe, mini bar (reasonable prices) and WIFI. Bathroom was clean and very spacious. The room was on the first floor and in front of the breakfast room. Coffee or tea was free till 8pm. The staff was helpful and friendly. Near the reception was a computer with internet connection (free). Also at the reception you could find dozens of flyers that you could make your stay more pleasant in this metropolis. Metro Diagonal is just 50m away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: vektro1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice area of Barcelona, and next to a metro stop with a few connecting lines. Room was nice. I was facing the street, with a small balcony. Staff was always helpful, and English wad not a problem. 3 Gaudi buildings are within 3 blocks. I would definitely stay there again. Great value & location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: scs1207
Reviews.Content: Hotel Actual is centrally located on Passeig de Gracia right around the corner from a lot of designer brand stores and La Pedrera only one block away. The subway stop "Diagonal" is only steps from the hotel, as well as a stop for the sightseeing busses. Our room was very spacious and clean and looked just like on the website. There's free WiFi in the rooms and two computer terminals in the lobby. The hotel is situated at a very busy intersection, but even if your room is facing the street you'll get a good night's sleep if you leave the windows closed at night. Since we booked only the room I can't say anything about breakfast (we went to the Starbucks right across the street, where you'll find very friendly, english speaking staff and lots of fellow tourists *g*). There are tons of cafés and restaurants in the area. All in all it was a very pleasant stay and I can warmy recommend Hotel Actual.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 stars boutique hotel, I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: WORLDSCITIZEN68
Reviews.Content: Actual has a suberb location, just on the corner of Paseo de Gracia, for me, one of the best avenue for shopping in Barcelona which concentrate the best brends of the world, like, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Dior, YSL, Fendi, Diesel etc.., and its neighborhood "Eixample" is fantastic to discover some of the most famous architecture of Barcelona as Casa Batlló,La Pedrera, Sagrada familia, etc.., and also is easy to find nice restaurants and Tapa bars. the hotel is modern from the lobby and halls to the bedrooms. We stayed on the 4th floor in a standard room, that it was big, but it had enough space for ours lugagges. the bathroom isn't big too, but both ate cozy and modern. you find some facilities as flat tv, safe box, mini bar, air conditioning and wi fi. The staff were friendly all the time and when i visit Barcelona again , surely my option will be Actual hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: soterman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Actual last week, on a holiday with my wife. The overall experience was trouble free, the room was nice, clean, average size, beds were fine, amenities were almost complete, daily cleaning service was there. The hotel is at the corner of Carrer de Rosselo and Passeig de Gracia, a really nice avenue, with stops for the metro and bus. The area is safe, there's always people even at 1.30am, as there are lots of shops and cafes at the vicinity. Almost all hotels in Barcelona (not hostels) are more expensive than, say 100 euros per day. And charge another additional 6-14 euros per head for breakfast. Hotel Actual fits into that category, it's a average priced hotel in an expensive city. To sum it up, If it was slightly cheaper I'd definitely stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Should be five star, not three! Don´t stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Princesses_111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, clean and in a great location - a very trendy and up-market area (we felt very safe!). It is close to great shops and good food. The hotel staff are very helpful. They directed us to many great restaurants, shopping malls and bars. We are a group of three girls with high standards and would recommend this place to our friends and anyone else looking for a great experience in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Titibert-Mexico
Reviews.Content: This tiny hotel is situated right on Paseo de Gracia, but the entrance is around the corner on Rosello Street. It has very modern minimalist decor. The rooms are pretty small, normal in european hotels , but the location is perfect and the price is too. If you can afford it book the junior suite for 175 euros to have a large room. The superior double room rate, 130 euros a night. We got these great prices at booking.com. Be sure to stay in the newly renovated area. The only downside, normal rooms do not have double glass windows and Paseo de Gracia is a pretty busy avenue. Metro station is right there and there are lots of restaurants at walking distance. Paseo de Gracia has all the high end stores and is a nice area to walk. Would stay there again definetely!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nyellen2
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern hotel located in a great location. Metro and bus stops on the corner. L'Exiample is a beautiful section of Barcelona. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Giantbubu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it's located very near the Metro, so good for those late night returns. We got a room with an extra bed and found it spacious and comfortable. Really appreaciated the free coffee on the 1st floor and amused ourselves, treating it as our coffee room. As with modern hotels, free wifi included.

Reviews.Title: “stylish, modern, clean, comfortable, limited service.”
Reviews.Author: Danpengillmer
Reviews.Content: generally good location. desk staff helpful. nice little cafe for breakfast (not included). little noisy (room was over passeig gracias.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in a very nice spot.”
Reviews.Author: Evangelia5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location(Passeig De Gracia), very central, just one step from the metro station, the bus stop and the turistic bus stop. Close to famous stores, restaurants, cafes, snack bars etc and just a few metres from La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. It is a very clean, quiet enough hotel (given that our room was facing a street with a lot of traffic). The WI-FI was very good, very fast even though the room was at the top floor (6th). Minimalistic design,all furnitures in the room in great condition. Bathroom was very clean, cleaning service every day, towels changed daily,luggage keeping service for free (and it's safe). The staff was polite and helpfull. Maybe the only issue is that the hotel is not very spacious and our room was also not roomy (double superior with city view) and had a very small balkony.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money doesn't even cover it!”
Reviews.Author: MrsOg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend break - three nights - and in one of their standard rooms. I was really pleasantly surprised by the size of the room - much larger than many hotels I've stayed in (particularly in the uk) and was spotlessly clean. The decor was modern and unfussy. Our room faced over Carrer de Rossello and the corner at Passeig de Gracia - and as a very light sleeper I can honestly say I had no problems at all with the noise (although we did have the windows fully closed, and it was quieter as it was February). The staff were so friendly - I am so surprised at the reviews saying anything otherwise - and when we tried to speak Catalan with them they were so nice and accommodating of our mistakes! They couldn't have done more for us. The situation of the hotel is also excellent - I hurt my foot a couple of days before the holiday and couldn't walk far. But it was 10 steps to the metro, maybe 20 to the tourist bus stop and taxis were very reasonably priced and safe. Being on the same block as La Pedrera, and a few steps away from some of the best bars and eateries in the city was very special. I would recommend this place, but not to too many people - I want to have it as my own secret!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Stop Over Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dr_hard_to_please
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Actual in order to experience a bit of Barca before setting off on a cruise around the western Med with Celebrity Cruises. The hotel is smaller than you are made to believe but you shoud not be out off. We found the hotel to be quiet and efficient. The decor is clean and modern but not high end. The rooms are cool, quite large with well appointed bathrooms. The shower will blow you away with its power!! The beds are quite hard and the sweltering heat we encountred buring a partibularly humid October was counteracted by the air con. I would recommend this hotel for stop overs but not for a week's stay. It features no character whatsoever if you prefer Barca style. I would say that fashion forward types would enjoy the stay but its not unusual enough to excite the interiors enthusiasts. For those who prefer clean over character, I would recommend it, just don't expect the Barca experience within your four walls. Its location is excellent. Within seconds you are within the hub of the city. We found a fantastic bar directly opposite the hotel where we spend an amazing evening sipping cocktails (except you can expect to ay around 12 Euros for a glass of gin and tonic containing around 5 measures of gin) which was quite an expereince. The ambience is affluent and very contemporary. Breakfast offered a very vast array. No full english as you'd hope in the temperature but a very adequate supply of fruit, pastries hams and rolls, good coffee and juices. You woudn't be disappointed. We left after a good night's sleep and left for the port after a leisurely check out on a Saturday morning. Overall 8/10. Slightly dull, does what it says on the tin, not luxe, no areas of complaint however. Perhaps I just can't put my finger on it!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, untransparent prices and rude personnel ruined our stay”
Reviews.Author: Mlle_Aless
Reviews.Content: The hotel messed up with our reservation and therefore while we reserved a family us, we got two rooms next door with a window facing a wall. The toilet was not working properly. We were never informed that breakfast was charged separately. The personnel at reception was very rude. Although location is very good and breakfast was excellent, I would not recommend the hotel due to it's poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable The best 3-star hotel hotel we stayed at in Spain”
Reviews.Author: gankor
Reviews.Content: This is an under-rated 3-star hotel - modern, minimalist design, with large rooms and bathroom. The double door feature - where the bedroom has its own door - ensures that there is minimal noise from the corridor unlike most other 3-star hotels which tend to be very noisy. Our stay here was very comfortable. There is also free WiFi access. Reasonable rates make this the best value-for-money 3-star hotel we stayed at in Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Wonderful Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ViennaWriter
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona with my mother-in-law and sister-in-law on a two-week travel vacation throughout Spain. We flew from Newark, NJ to Barcelona on September 25 and landed on the morning of September 26. We took a cab to Hotel Actual, a metropolitan hotel located on the corner of the main shopping street, Passig de Gracia and Rossello. The hotel is on Rossello. I recommend it not because it is fancy, but because it is centrally-located, clean, has a nice breakfast, Internet service, and an English speaking staff. The restaurants and tourist locations around the hotel are plenty; but I do recommend taking the tourist bus around town so you can get to more far away places like the soccer stadium and other points of interest around the city, like Park Gruel, the place of many pieces of Antoni Gaudi's famous works of art. We paid for a triple rate. I got the reservation through contacting them directly via email off their Web site: http://www.hotelactual.com/.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Great Location, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: issaaa
Reviews.Content: Overall our start at the hotel was pleasant. Other than the fact that the rooms are slightly small the hotel has am amazing location with outstanding staff. the people on the front desk were great and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel in the city center”
Reviews.Author: manolituca
Reviews.Content: Actual Barcelona is a perfect place be-it for a short city trip or business travel. The location in the center of Barcelona is perfect for exploring the city or having a nice dinner after a day full of meetings. The hotel is relatively small, very modern, comfortable and has very friendly and helpful staff. I will definitively stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eddr595
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much the hotel, except for the mistake we made making reservations on www.easytobook.com instead of directly booking at the hotel. Upon our arrival to the hotel, which as i mentioned happened to be really nice in a great location, we discovered that booking the room directly from the said hotel would’ve saved as more than 10%! The hotel staff was very friendly and tried to help, but unfortunately it was too late as we made a mistake making our reservation on easytobook.com! Bottom line: despite their claim “No Extra Charges No reservation fees” we were overcharged by 200€ for our mistake booking on this website!

Reviews.Title: “Locked out”
Reviews.Author: kush6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, simple and sufficient. It is in a good location, however there is no guide, no room service, and no amenities you would usually find in a hotel. We paid 85 euros per night, which was acceptable when we arrived considering there was AC and it seemed clean enough. It is TINY, you can't open the door to the bathroom because the door hits the toilet, you can barely stand at the sink without actually sitting on the toilet. Again, very clean which is the plus but does not feel like a hotel. Okay. So. We came home late, 5AM and the DOOR WAS LOCKED. LOCKED. My key never works when I go to my room which is annoying but I couldn't even get into the hotel! The guys across the street were laughing. We went across the street and they were calling the person who supposedly works here because we were banging on the door. I have never experienced such a thing. It was honestly unbelievable, 5AM and locked out of my hotel. The guy finally came down and opened the door, me and my boyfriend waiting, along with one single woman, luckily she had us to keep her company. We finally got into the hotel and he asked us to be patient and wait for another elevator as he was using one. UNBELIEVABLE. Clean simple hotel but be aware you may not be able to get in whenever you want.\\ Great location, especially for shopping, near high end retail, safe neighborhood, felt like 5th avenue in NYC - but to say amenities were lacking would be an understatement. Clean and sufficient, front desk person not able to help with site seeing questions at all, said yes to everything, coudln't get in late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation and good location right next to metro.”
Reviews.Author: 83Lona
Reviews.Content: Receptionist was really helpful in advising us on places to see and transport to use. We had a bit of a hassle with tickets of a concert which had to be delivered to the hotel 2 days before the concert. Thankfully they arrived and as soon as they were delivered they phoned us to let us know. :) The room was spacious enough with a large double bed and space to put two suitcases around. I really liked the double door system and shower had high pressured water that was great after a long day roaming around. Hotel is really quiet didnt hear a thing all night. It was spotless and cleaning was done everday...i really enjoyed coming back to the hotel evrey night. :)

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem in a GREAT City!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying 4 nights in this wonderful little 3 Star underrated hotel and our experience could not have been better, except for the fact that the airlines lost my luggage and I have not recovered it yet. The staff (Monica, Bet, and management) went WAY beyond what would be expected to help me find my luggage. They called the airlines numerous times to inquire and translate for me, and called me several times to keep me informed of what was going on. The hotel is located just steps away from the elegant and beautiful Passeig de Gracia, the elite shopping district, with the wonderful Barcelona architecture. The hotel is very sleek and modern, and clean as a pin. I would recommend Room #621 which has a wonderful view of the Avenue. The room is spacious and has a great comfortable king bed, shower, and bathroom. The Barcelona Sightseeing Bus, Metro, La Rambla, and dozens of great restaurants are a short walk from the hotel. The hotel served the best breakfast we ate in our entire 11 day trip to northeast Spain. We have stayed in many 4 and 5 Star hotels throughout Europe and this ranks as one of our best stays. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMan0612
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona and a major contributing factor to our enjoyment of this outstanding city were our experiences at this hotel. The hotel staff, from Bet, Monica, Marcel, Ernesto and Maria Jose, among others, were unfailingly helpful, professional and friendly. It was a pleasure to interact with them and many times they provided us with crucial information. Cannot say enough good things about them. The hotel itself is of an attractive minimalist design. Nice reception area, cafe and lounge. We asked for a quiet room (noise can be an issue in Barcelona) and were given a first floor room (no view) that was indeed almost tomb-like quite except around 8:30AM? when housekeeping staff would make a beeline for the supply closet near our room. Did not have an issue with this. The room itself was nicely decorated and designed, albeit a bit small. There are larger rooms and the room prices are very reasonable. The breakfast in the Cafe at 12 Euros was a bit pricey. Could not get the Wi-Fi to work, so used the lobby computer, which worked fine. Overall, an appealing ambiance without some of the amenities of more expensive hotels, such as a fitness center, swimming pool or business conference rooms, with a price to reflect this. Great for those watching how they are spending their money. The location is terrific, high end, safe and close to many attractions. Designer shops, high end shopping venues, restaurants and more reasonably priced shopping abounds everywhere. Another bonus was the proximity of the Metro, buses and other means of transportation right around the corner. Overall, a superb experience for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, beautiful minimalist design”
Reviews.Author: butnotrmpt
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 8 nights. The hotel is lovely, the staff nice, the rooms crisp and well designed, the bathroom comfortable with a large countertop and a good shower. We had no complaints about room size. It was modest but the design made it work well. We moved around with ease. There were small nightstands on each side, an easy chair, a desk, and a long bench where you could easily place your suitcases for packing and unpacking. Our suitcases fit under the bench for storage. Our 2 very comfortable beds were made up separately but right next to one another, which allowed for more space on either side. That worked for us as a mother and daughter - 2 friends traveling together might have liked a little more separation though. The lighting was good. A flat panel tv hung on the wall. There was a built in armoire, with shelves on one side, hanging space on the other. Some of the shelf room was taken up by a small safe (fit my netbook!) and a refrigerator, but the space was still adequate for us. I can't imagine how much stuff people must be traveling with if they did not have enough storage space. A nice feature is that the entry hall and bathroom can be closed off from the main room with a solid door. We heard no sound from the elevators, even though our room was right next to them. There was free wifi. If you are sensitive to street noise, and you want to keep your window open, do not take a room facing the street. My daughter wanted the window open all the time, so we moved to a rear room, which overlooked the rear of La Padrera. It was very quiet at night, but unfortunately there were several projects going on in neighboring buildings and so we heard the construction noise when we were in the room during the day. This is not an issue unless you spend the day in the room - not typical for either a business or recreational visitor. Closing the window solved the problem almost completely. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaI031
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in August for 4 nights. Excellent location and wonderful neighborhood. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Couldn't ask for a better value. Great neighborhood to stroll in the evenings. And convenient to everything with the Metro stop right nearby. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: spartac
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Barcelona tend to be very expensive. I booked Hotel Actual for 3 nights at the very reasonable 95 Euro (+ tx) per night, for two. Look at websites for bargains as official rack rate was higher. No breakfast included in the price but there are 2-3 very good breakfast options next door or almost across the street. PROs: - Very nice boutique Hotel feel. Not many rooms per floor. - Very quiet. We had the room 510, facing the back. The double door system does block any interior noise. The view was partially somewhat obstructed (wall on the right side, 3-5 meters from the window). But otherwise we had a view of Casa Mila, one of Gaudi's masterpieces. Room 511 has better view. It is closer to the elevator though. But I think it shouldn't be noisy as its bathroom should buffer any noise - Decent Location. Very close to Metro Diagonal on the green line (the main line for tourist's interests). Located in the quiet Eixample. 15 min walk to Placa de Catalunya. - Complementary internet access. CONs: - Locations: Although Eixample is very nice, quiet, close to everything, it's still not my preferred area. Barri Gothic is livelier. The hotel is not located in a dead zone though. It's alive but it's just more upscale residential with restaurants here and there, while being close to everything - The rooms are a bit on the minimalistic side. Although amenities were sufficient there was no trace of any personal or special touch. When I return to Barcelona I would look for a similar hotel in or near the Barri Gothic. But given the value of Hotel Actual there is a high chance I return here.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good service, small room”
Reviews.Author: ACsTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location near metro stops in a beautiful and safe neighborhood for those late night walks. It's also right around the corner from Gaudi's Casa Mila and my room had a view of the roof! I stayed in one of the 5 small rooms located near the (quiet) elevator for about $100/night. These rooms are much smaller than those shown on the website but still clean and modern with a good bathroom. The small room was perfect for me as a solo traveler but it would have been a very cramped space to share as some others near me were doing as there was barely floor space for one suitcase. The staff were helpful and friendly. There's free wireless and a computer for guest use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in a perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: datterom
Reviews.Content: I just visited Barcelona for the first time with my husband and some family. Hotel Actual provided the perfect backdrop for a visit to Barcelona. It was located near a metro stop, shopping and some great tapa restaurants. The hotel staff was extremely helpful when asking for a tapa's restaurant to dine at while celebrating my sister's 30th birthday. We were even lucky enough to have a room that overlooked one of Gaudi's structures. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most understanding reception staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Kes1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December 2008 for our works Christmas do. The hotel staff were very welcoming......baring in mind we were all wearing santa suits and issued us with a room key each. The rooms were lovely, very modern, spacious and beautifully presented. We took over 2 floors of the hotel and began getting into the Christmas spirit. Throughout our stay several room keys were "missplaced" but the hotel staff were very quick to replace them and extremely polite. They all spoke perfect English and happily ordered us numerous taxis and offered advice on where to go. The hotel is very well located in an affluent area of Barcelona. It is right next to the Diagonal tube station which is on the main line straight into town and runs for 24 hours. It is in a quiet area but very easily accessable. Very few taxi drivers recognise the name of the hotel though, so its often best to ask them to take you to Diagonal tube station. The only problem we had was with the hotel bar, we had to request for it be opened at 8pm and then left within half an hour as we were the only people in there, it isnt the ideal place to get a quiet drink before you go out as the bar staff don't really seem to know what they are doing. All in all it was a lovely hotel and i would definately stay here again when visiting Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend in October”
Reviews.Author: balliso3-Bruce
Reviews.Content: Hotel Actual, Barcelona, Oct 2008 – We booked Hotel Actual from the UK some months in advance via agent Alpha-Rooms.com for 3 nights including bed and breakfast. The Tripadvisor reviews were all really good and the deal price was OK. And it exceeded our expectations - all recent good reviews were correct! Some useful pointers on this hotel - we didn't realise till the 2nd night that the air conditioning (very effective) in the room would only switch on if the window is closed. The TV does offer varied channels but only CNN and BBC World News were in English (there's no DVD player and no radio channel) . However sightseeing around the city (Gaudi's great buildings, the harbour area, Las Ramblas street walks etc) meant missing any decent TV was no great hardship. You can check out on your last day as late as 12 noon, and leave your luggage reasonably secure off the lobby if you have a late flight home. In Oct 2008 there were major road works at the Diagonal junction near the hotel which made access from that metro station to the hotel with heavy luggage in fact quite difficult (we used a taxi on the way home for the first part of our airport journey, as the metro change involved a very long walkway tunnel at one stage of the airport journey). Also be aware that the modern classy lifts are smooth and silent when moving, but give quite a loud "bonk" when stopping at a floor – in case you’re a light sleeper and get a room near the lift (only 5 rooms on each floor). The receptionists and breakfast room staff were friendly and helpful - and even got a plumber to our room within 20 minutes one day when we ran out of toilet tissue (something got lost in translation I think). We thought our inclusive buffet breakfasts were good including excellent pineapple, kiwi fruit and peaches, hard boiled eggs, cheeses, cold cuts of meats, croissants, rolls, bread and toast, jam and marmalade, fruit juices and teas or coffee. We thought the bathroom was fine – including the bath and shower. The hotel has a certain wow factor with its modern minimalist and stylish decor and furnishings. We'd happily stay there again, but not for a long stay as the bedroom furniture is really geared to short stays (no drawers, only shelves, only 6 hangers etc) and the breakfast menu of course remains unvaried. But perfect for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Actual is in a great area of Barcelona, lots of upscale Boutiques are all around. I was just staying on business so I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel or the surrounding area, but it is also located off of one of the main boulevards in Barcelona so you can get anywhere quickly. The rooms are nice, decorated in a minimalist style, very simple and clean. The bathroom is nice with a good shower. The hotel also offers free internet which was really nice as I had my laptop. The service was good and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bawood3
Reviews.Content: New, modern hotel in a great location next to Metro. Internet available in the lobby, very clean rooms with coffee, tea all day at no charge. Breakfast very pricey but available down the street. Staff very helpful making restaurant reservations, good english, requesting taxi for early morning pick up to airport. We stayed there 3 nights and can highly recommend it for any type of traveler. Room size may not be the best for a family if you are trying to sleep more than three. View it at www.hotelactual.com

Reviews.Title: “Actual - Actually very good”
Reviews.Author: Stan.stan
Reviews.Content: Thought this small hotel was an ideal place to stay for a 4 night stay. Bedroom and bathroom, modern, minimalist and very clean. Location wise - very good - in the equivalent of a "Regent Street" shopping area - 15 min walk to the Place Catalunya (one end of the Ramblas). Bus stop for the Bus Turistic 15 yards away (Blue and Red route). Would stay again. Only one criticism - we stayed in room 311 which was next to a lift shaft which was a bit noisy. On departure, reception said they would get it fixed.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bumbling_traveller
Reviews.Content: perfect location just steps away from the Diagonal metro; also very close to Gaudi's masterpieces. Not the cheapest place we stayed, but good location and friendly / helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the staff are very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Young_couple30
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Actual on the 16th of August 2007, and stayed 4 days. Our first impression was very positive, the staff was friendly, polite and helpful, the rooms were clean, not very big, but cosy, the decoration was pleasant, and the bathroom was big. We loved the pillows and the bed, very comfortable; we didn’t miss our pillows or mattress. The breakfast area was very nice, in a mezzanine, we see the street, about the food, there are several types of bread, cheese, hams, pastries, boiled eggs, tomatoes, coffee, tea, milk, juice, cereals, jams and fruit. The Hotel is very well located, in the corner of Passeio Garcia, the street of fashion, and shops, a very busy street, but despite of the season of the Festivities of Garcia, in the hotel room we didn't heard a noise. Comparing quality, location and price, we recommend Hotel Actual, because we had a good stay and enjoyed a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Actually a nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elchie
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three night stay (Thursday-Sunday.) The hotel was very clean and crisp: minimalist decor, comfortable bed, and a terrace door in the room (no terrace, but nice to have it open and look out below.) The room was not spacious, but it did not feel cramped either. The staff was very friendly and spoke English well. The location was a mixed bag for me: it's right off the Pg. de Gracia, the main upscale shopping street (an Yves St. Laurent store is next door.) During the day the area bustles with shoppers, but at night it's much quieter (safe and comfortable, not deserted and eerie.) I read reviews about hotels on Las Ramblas being very noisy, but I think I would have preferred to be a little closer to the action to get a feel for Barcelona at night., especially on the weekend The hotel is right next to the Diagonal metro station, but also next to a great bus stop that has buses going straight down to Las Ramblas (in general, I found the bus system to be more convenient than the metro.) The walk from the hotel to Las Ramblas was about 10-15 minutes. I would recommend this hotel, especially for travelers looking for a relaxing, convenient place to stay away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: N.Davies
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Actual in July. Room and breakfast was Euro 169.00, which was a bit expensive. However, July is not the cheapest month to visit Barcelona. The hotel is a good 3 star hotel. The room was a bit small but nicely furnished, clean, tidy and quiet. Breakfast was better than average for a hotel and in a nice setting overlooking reception and with views of the main street. The hotel is in the Exiample area of the city. It has a good location close to the Passage de Gracia and the Catalunya Rambla (not to be confused with La Rambla!) where there are lots of shops, bars and different places to eat. It is within close walking distance to the Gaudi houses and the Familia de Sagrada. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona and would probably return to it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Forewarned is forearmed!”
Reviews.Author: frequentravelor
Reviews.Content: If you need a computer or computer access, this is NOT the hotel for you. Fabulous location, clean, well-appointed small rooms, this hotel is located directly across from the popular Omm Hotel. Front desk service at the Actual is uneven at best. Messages are not relayed immediately, and one clerk forgot to take the name of the caller. Everyone speaks English. There is no bellman, and there are steps to access the lobby. Breakfast is average, costs 10 euros, and there is a small bar. Complimentary tea and coffee are always available. The windows open for fresh air, but the street below is very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkyMarkD
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get upgraded to here from the adjacent Hotel Paseo de Gracia which we understand is commonly owned. The hotel is very modern and minimalist; the rooms are small but functional with reasonable value mini-bar. The breakfast is EUR10 per person (not EUR20 as someone else has posted) and good quality for the not-so-cheap price. We had views from the window of our room of La Pedrera - but the views at the Hotel PDG are better, if you get a room with a terrace, because from the Actual you can't see anything BUT the roof of La Pedrera. Very convenient for Diagonal Metro station or Barcelona Passeig de Gracia mainline station (around 400m walk). Better not to bother with the metro if you have bags as there are too many stairs. A1 Airport bus also stops very near Barcelona Passeig de Gracia mainline station - maybe 500m from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: inchicore
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a budget hotel with clean, simple bedrooms, friendly staff and convienience to metro and auto routes then this hotel is spot on. For an extra €18 + tax they will give you parking, they even let me leave my car in the car park for quite some time even though I had checked out. The brasserie around the corner to the left is excellent so there is no need to pay the extra breakfast charge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Minimalist Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SUMMAGOLD
Reviews.Content: Clean minimalist hotel. Friendly staff. Small room, but very comfortable bed and linens. Average-sized (surprisingly, considering the size of the room) modern clean bathrooms. On a busy street, but when window closed, the city street noise disappeared. We live in a city, so the street noise didnt bother us. Less than one block from Metro. 10 minute walking distance to Gaudi's Casa Batlló, and it might have been a 10-15 minute walk to Gaudi's Sagrada Familia, if we hadnt gotten lost. On Metro, 3 quick stops to Las Ramblas. If we were to do again, we would book a place closer to Las Ramblas, as most of the nightlife was located there. Metro is not 24 hours. I think it stops after 12 am. Beyond that time, you are stuck with a taxi, which can get pricey (about 5-6 euros). And at that hour, and everyone trying to make their way home after a night of partying, competition for a taxi is fierce! Overall, I would recommend this to my parents or a couple who wouldnt really partake in Barcelona nightlife.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Actual
HotelInfo.Address: Rossello 238 | Corner Passeig de Grácia, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
